channel.title: Journal – StefanCarlton.net
channel.description: my little place on the web

item.title: You know something, Mary Schmich & Baz Luhrman were right (Everyone is Free)
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Thirteen years ago a song was released which addressed many of the insecurities that we all feel. It dispensed advice and explained that whilst ultimately our existence wouldn’t change, we could do something to feel better about ourselves. The song itself was based on an article called “Advice, like youth, probably just wasted on the young” written by Mary Schmich in 1997 and reading the lyrics are hauntingly familiar all these years later!

item.title: The start of the end
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: A dramatic title with so many questions – the end of what? Am I finished with travelling? Am I going home? Well, no, not quite, but then I’m settling down for a while and this has been a long time coming.

item.title: Sleeping in a dorm – how to practice
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: One aspect of travelling that was new to me (and presumably most people) is sleeping in dormitories – here are a few ways you can prepare yourself.

item.title: Returning to my biking ways
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: I always liked riding bikes as a kid but in recent years started to ride a Mountain Bike with vengeance pushing myself hard both physically and technically. I’ve ridden bikes a few times as I travelled but never felt fully fulfilled – In Siem Reap I tried again and boy did it turn out well.

item.title: Today, I’m hating travelling
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Everyone always talks about how great travelling is, how you meet so many people you are never alone and how you see loads of interesting things. It’s not all like that. There are days when you get sick of travelling and you just want to give it all up…

item.title: A different type of Christmas
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: As 2011 comes to a close, it brings with it not only an eight month anniversary of travelling but also my first holiday season away from my family. It’s a strange to be surrounded by 63 other travellers and partying all day!

item.title: 12 Days Of Christmas – 1 Happy Traveller
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: morrow is Christmas Day and thus ends my 12 day countdown. I hope you've enjoyed reading them as much I did thinking about them and that Santa brings you something nice. There is only one thing left to say, Merry Christmas everyone.

item.title: 12 Days Of Christmas – 2 Hemispheres played in
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: It’s Christmas Eve Eve and Santa is readying the sleigh, feeding up the reindeers, polishing Rudolf’s nose and checking the naughty and nice list one last time. He’ll start his journey in the Southern Hemisphere just East of Australia and finish up in the Northern Hemisphere near Hawaii. I wonder if he has as much […]

item.title: 12 Days of Christmas – 3 Border Crossings
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Border crossing should be routine and easily accomplished but as any traveller knows, this is far from the case. Continuing the 12 Days of Christmas countdown, here are 3 of my more troublesome encounters.

item.title: 12 Days of Christmas – 4 injuries accumulated
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: This one will make my mother cringe – my travels haven’t exactly been injury free, here are four of the more interesting problems I’ve had…
